p: Table 5 shows antibacterial activity of five different topical ointments containing EOs of C. martini in three different concentrations. From all formulation hydrophilic ointment has the highest antibacterial activity at all formulated concentrations against all the test bacteria with inhibition zone diameter ranging from 4.0±1.0 to 33.3±0.5 ( Table 5). Comparatively, both hydrophilic ointment and macrogol blend ointment showed significant antibacterial activity against all the tested skin disease causing bacteria. On the other hand, macrogol cream ointment, simple ointment, and white petrolatum ointment formulations of C. martini showed no antibacterial growth inhibition activity against the tested bacteria.
